alert.note: Alert for Breckinridge; Grayson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:43PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Grayson and southwestern Breckinridge Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 243 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southwest of Hardinsburg, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Grayson and southwestern Breckinridge Counties, including the following locations... Tar Fork, Mcquady, Kirk, Vanzant, Dempster, Rockvale, Glen Dean, Askin, Axtel and Mattingly. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Louisville.
